page.title: 11The Railway of Endon (1).
page.content: The present line is now a single line for the whole of its length and it is still used for freight traffic, serving the quarries at Caldon Low and the British Industrial Sand Works at Oakamoor.Endon Station was a typical country station with two platforms and loading docks,a level crossing,signal box,booking hall and office,waiting rooms and a goods yard.Both platforms had gateways leading on to a dock area, which was to allow the easy loading of milk churns and for passengers to get on and off the trains. Most of the milk was taken to Stoke-on-Trent.The gas lighting for the station was produced by dripping water into calcium carbide which formed an acetylene gas. In the goods yard there were two sidings,a covered storage area, a weighbridge a cattle dock and a coal depot office.
